glsa.title: Ruby: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A flaw in the Ruby standard library might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service attack.

background.p: Ruby is an interpreted object-oriented programming language. The elaborate standard library includes the "BigDecimal" class.

description.p: Tadayoshi Funaba reported that BigDecimal in ext/bigdecimal/bigdecimal.c does not properly handle string arguments containing overly long numbers.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this issue to remotely cause a Denial of Service attack.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Ruby users should upgrade to the latest version:
